intro_text: Your patrol scents a loner on the territory. They confront the scavenger, who quickly surrenders and begs for shelter.
decline_text: Your patrol decides the loner isn't worth their time.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol relents and the loner is allowed to join the Troop.
The patrol relents and the loner is allowed to join the Troop, bringing along their litter of hungry cubs.

fail_outcomes.text: The loner seems to have second thoughts. They quickly turn tail and take off. Good riddance, then.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol advances threateningly towards the loner, who retaliates with a quick swipe to p_l's face. While p_l is stunned, they make their getaway.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol tells the scavenger to leave or feel their spears. The loner seems to choose life and quickly takes off.

fail_outcomes.text: The city scav gradually becomes more and more frightened at the patrol's descriptions of Troop life. They decide to turn tail and run.

intro_text: r_c finds a wounded scavenger at the bottom of a drop.
decline_text: They leave the wounded scavenger alone.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol climbs down sees some signs of life. The patrol, after some hesitation, decides to bring the scavenger back to camp so that they can be treated by the healer. The scavenger thanks them profusely and promises to repay them by joining the Troop and being the best warrior they can.

fail_outcomes.text: As r_c inspects the scavenger, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} find that they have already passed into their next life.
The scavenger attempt to carry the stranger back to camp, but the stranger passes on the way. They stop to tuck the body somewhere secluded before continuing home.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol tries to drive the scavenger away, but they trip and fall, and don't get back up. The patrol takes a bit of time to bury them - just to keep predators away.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol drives the scavenger off of the territory. It's not c_n's problem.

intro_text: r_c finds an abandoned cub whose parents are nowhere to be found.
decline_text: They decide to leave the cub alone.

success_outcomes.text: The cub is taken back to camp and nursed back to health.

fail_outcomes.text: The cub is taken back to camp, but grows weak and dies a few days later.
The patrol approaches the cub, only to realize that it's already gone. They swiftly bury it and move on.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The cub carries a few belongings from the city. Your patrol has no interest in what will surely grow to be a weak scavenger.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol moves the cub away from the territory. They have no interest in strange cubs.

decline_text: The patrol declines their offer and sends them off.

fail_outcomes.text: After hearing more about your Troop, the loner decides not to join, quickly turning and taking off.

intro_text: Your patrol cautiously moves towards the sound of a lizard's hissing. Near the border, they spot a lizard chasing something. Oh no, it's a scavenger!
decline_text: The patrol decides not to interfere. Surely the scavenger can handle itself, the lizard isn't even that big.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol swiftly jumps into action. They capture the lizard's attention and draw it away from the stranger before showing it the sharp ends of their spears. Meanwhile, r_c checks on the stranger. They're unharmed, and this display of bravery makes them want to join the Troop!

s_c leaps into action, pelting towards the lizard and hurling a cherrybomb. Thrashing in panic, the lizard abandons the chase as s_c pursues it with spear raised. The loner, ruffled but unharmed, is amazed by this display. After some chatting, they decide to join the Troop.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol swiftly jumps into action. They capture the lizard's attention and draw it away from the stranger before showing it the sharp ends of their spears. r_c stayed hidden while the rest of the patrol lured the lizard away, but when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/go/goes} to find the stranger, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} that it's still running! Oh well, at least they're alright.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The loner fights the lizard off themself and scowls at the patrol, who stood by watching, over its body. The patrol leers back in return. c_n doesn't owe loners anything.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol watches as the loner scrambles up a pole to escape the lizard, and then promptly proceed to kill the beast and viciously spit at the loner not to cross the border.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear an odd sound coming from a nearby crevice.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: p_l goes to check the crevice and finds a city scav cowering inside. The pathetic thing looks terrified and after a p_l raises {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} spear it goes scrambling back out of the territory.
p_l pads towards the crevice to check on the noise when a lantern mouse suddenly bursts out! None of the scavengers are quick enough to catch it, but at least the noise was nothing dangerous.

s_c takes the lead in checking the noise, and it's a good thing {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} did, because the moment {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} step closer to the bush a rogue comes springing out! s_c is quick to smack them away, squeaking in shock, before promptly chasing the rogue out of the territory.  It was hardly a fight, really.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l shuffles closer to the crevice, intent on finding the source of the noise, only to come face to face with a baby noodlefly! The patrol have to scatter when its mother comes hurtling out of the sky, ready to skewer them all.

s_c doesn't even hesitate before splitting from the patrol to check on the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} quickly {VERB/s_c/regret/regrets} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} impulsivity, however, when an angry noodlefly bursts from within!  s_c gets quite the scare, but thankfully the creature only wanted to get away from {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. It flies off with its young clinging to its tail.

p_l takes the lead in checking the source of the noise and comes face to face with a rogue hiding in the crevice! The rogue takes a swipe at p_l, but doesn't get much damage in before p_l retaliates and chases the intruder out of c_n territory.

history_text.scar: m_c gained a scar after tussling with a rogue.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a rogue.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l starts to shuffle towards the crevice. Before {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} can even reach it, however, a gang of rogues bursts out of hiding! A fight ensues and though the rogues are eventually driven off, r_c is killed in the process.

history_text.scar: m_c gained a scar after tussling with a rogue.
history_text.reg_death: m_c was killed by a rogue.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: p_l finds a gang of rogues in the crevice! p_l has to turn tail and run, the rogues' jeers chasing {PRONOUN/p_l/object} back to camp.

antag_success_outcomes.text: p_l goes to check the bush and finds a city scav cowering inside. p_l smacks it and sends it on its way.

intro_text: While searching for some specific herbs, p_l is startled by weird sounds and whispers on the wind.
decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from StarClan or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

success_outcomes.text: The sounds die away and then start up again in strange, unpredictable intervals. Investigating, p_l suddenly finds {PRONOUN/p_l/self} nose to nose with a panting, bleeding queen, desperately splashing water from a tiny puddle on a stranded batch of larvae. p_l brings the queen back to camp, where the Troop, suspicious but obedient to the code, takes them in.

p_l finds a worn and weary queen trying to keep their newborn batch of larvae hydrated in a tiny puddle. Not happy but unwilling and unable to go against {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} beloved code, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/take/takes} them back to camp, refusing to let r_c say a word against it.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l sees the body of an unknown queen with their larvae beside them, slowly cooling in the morning breeze. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/are/is} filled with an unexpected sense of grief and p_l and the rest of the patrol take the time to carry and bury them outside their borders.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown queen and their larvae beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/return/returns} home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mind clouded.

antag_success_outcomes.text: p_l hisses at StarClan for the sign, refusing to follow it to its source, and what might have been.

p_l and {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol come across a batch of stranded grubs, slowly dehydrating as they crawl on the cold body of their parent. Unsure but not willing for them to die, the patrol brings the cubs back to the Troop to be raised as one of them.

intro_text: It's a cold day in c_n's territory, and app1 is the only one stepping out. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} by {PRONOUN/app1/self} when {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/hear/hears} a scavenger shrieking for help.
decline_text: Nope, not today, there's no way app1 is running after ghosts, no thank you.

success_outcomes.text: It's probably dangerous. But curiosity leads app1 on, where {PRONOUN/app1/subject} carefully {VERB/app1/peek/peeks} over a ridge as the source of the cries. A helpless city scav runs back and forth over a half-crumbled bridge, crying for their patrol to return again and again and again. It isn't until their voice has gone hoarse and scratchy, yet miraculously no predators have shown up, that app1 leaps out to surprise them - those city scavs aren't coming back, and the stranger can either follow app1 or become something's meal.

StarClan, but the scavenger {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/find/finds} is weird, their fur soft and thin, their cries desperate as they call in confusion. app1 watches until {PRONOUN/app1/poss} paws are cold and uncomfortable, crouched behind cover, but the dumb outsider doesn't even try to steal food, they just wail for help, quieter and quieter as they begin to lose their voice. It's a miracle nothing shows up to take a bite out of them. Finally, app1 can't take it anyone - striding out, {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/tell/tells} the scavenger to follow {PRONOUN/app1/object}. The Leader will know what to do with this.

app1 follows the sad cries to find a city scav, lost and alone and cold. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/watch/watches} from under the legs of some ancient device, but no, actually the stranger is that stupid and it really seems likely they'll get eaten if app1 doesn't do something. Ugh. Fine, app1 can bring them back to camp, and then it's the Leader's problem to deal with, not app1's.

fail_outcomes.text: The scavenger is scurrying all over the place, and finally, app1 gives up and goes home, too tired to catch more than a mouthful.

s_c calls out to the scavenger, only to be met with raucous cawing. {VERB/s_c/Are/Is} {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} being laughed at? {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/decide/decides} to slink off, leaving it be.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: app1 charges after the sound to attack the scavenger, only for a city scav to bowl {PRONOUN/app1/object} right over in their haste to get away.

antag_success_outcomes.text: app1 finds a high perch and slams {PRONOUN/app1/poss} spear on the ground to get the stranger's attention. once the eyes of the terrified city scav below are on {PRONOUN/app1/object}, app1 tells them that this is c_n's territory and there's no help for anyone else. The stranger heeds {PRONOUN/app1/object} words and runs for their life.
